definition_en: Used by a speaker to refer to himself or herself.
example_sentence_en: I am going to the store.

definition_en: Used to refer to the person the speaker is addressing informally.
example_sentence_en: You (informal) are going to the store.

definition_en: Used to refer to the person the speaker is addressing formally.
example_sentence_en: You (formal) are going to the store.

definition_en: Used to refer to a male person or animal.
example_sentence_en: He are going to the store.

definition_en: Used to refer to a female person or animal.
example_sentence_en: She are going to the store.

definition_en: Used to refer to the speaker and at least one other person.
example_sentence_en: We are going to the store.

definition_en: Used to refer to more than one person the speaker is addressing.
example_sentence_en: You all are going to the store.

definition_en: Used to refer to a group of males or mixed gender.
example_sentence_en: They (masculine or mixed) are going to the store.

definition_en: Used to refer to a group of females.
example_sentence_en: They (feminine) are going to the store.
